input.name: __VIEWSTATE

p.span: Per Governor Wolf's directive, the Avonworth School District will be closed for the remainder fo the 2019-2020 academic school year.
This includes all playgrounds, athletic fields, football stadium, track, and all school grounds.

All athletics, school-related events, and use of school district facilities are cancelled. We will provide updates to our school community as decisions are made regarding this closure. Updates, announcements, information, and resources related to COVID-19 and our District's response can be found here:

strong.span: School Board Meetings will be Held Virtually

p.span: Access information about attending Virtual School Board meetings here:

img.alt: Google Translate

div.span: Congratulations to Kat Goetz on being named to the PG AAA Fab 5 Girls Basketball Team!

img.alt: Photo of Kat Goetz dribbling a basketball during a game. She was named to the PG AAA Fab 5 Girls Basketball Team

div.span: Congratulations to the Avonworth Music Department! For the third year in a row, Avonworth School District has been recognized as one of the Best Communities for Music Education!

img.alt: Image stating 2020 Best Communities for Music Education with a background of different intstrumetns.

div.span: Click on "read more" below to access District announcements, resources, and information regarding COVID-19.

img.alt: Image of coronavirus from the Center for Disease Control (CDC).

div.span: Congratulations to Dr. Thomas Ralston on being named the PMEA Outstanding Superintendent!

img.alt: Photo of Dr. Ralston with Mr. Guess and students standing outside the high school auditorium

div.span: Congratulations to Middle School Teacher Megan Campedel for being named the NHL Teacher of the Month!

img.alt: Photo of middle school teacher holding a penguins jersey she was given after being named the NHL's Teacher of the Month. Megan Campedel is the teacher and she is standing in her classroom.

div.span: Congratulations Coach Duke Johncour - Pennsylvania Class 2A Coach of the Year!

img.alt: Photo of head football coach Duke Johncour hoisting the WPIAL 2A Championship trophy with his team surrounding him

div.span: Congratulations to the WPIAL 2A Champion and PIAA 2A Runner Up Avonworth Football Team. Photo courtesy of EFB Photography.

img.alt: Photo of the Avonworth Football Team on the field with the WPIAL 2A Champion trophy on the field in Norwin after winning the championship

div.span: Fabian Vasquez-Ramos, Garren Hoffman, & Aidan Brady Selected to District Choir

img.alt: Photo of three boys from the avonworth high school choir that were selected to district choir. The photo was taken in front of a bulletin board in the choir room.

div.span: Sixteen Avonworth Musicians Selected to the Allegheny Valley Junior High and Senior High Honors Bands

img.alt: Photo of sixteen musicians from the avonworth band that were selected to the allegheny valley junior high and senior high honors bands. Photo was taken in the band room at the high school.

div.span: JAM Enterprises Selected as a Top 100 Education Innovation by HundrED! Dr. Miller and Mrs. Frew Represent JAM Enterprises in Helsinki at the 2019 HundrED Summit.

img.alt: Photo of primary principal Dr. Miller and teacher Mrs. Frew standing on either side of sign with the word helsinki

div.span: Ryan Monti Ties for First Place in CMU's Creative Task Competition

img.alt: Photo of student Ryan Monti holding a certificate he earned when he tied for first place in the CMU creative task competition

div.span: Teachers Mrs Galecki and Mrs. Long Recognized for their Award-winning Lessons at the Antisemitism, Hate, and Social Responsibility Conference Presented by Classrooms Without Borders

img.alt: Photo of Mrs. Galecki and Mrs. Long holding certificates they were presented by classrooms without borders for their award winning lessons.

div.span: Middle School Science Teacher, Mrs. Campedel, Recognized by the Penguins as the Teacher of the Month

img.alt: Photo of teacher Mrs. Campedel at the PPG arena when she was recognized by the Penguins as the teacher of the month in november.

div.span: Avonworth School District Recognized at CelebratED Event by the TransformED Center for Creativity for its Commitment to Transformational Change

img.alt: Photo of Avonworth administrators and teachers in front of the CelebratED banner with balloons on each side at an event this fall where the district was recognized for its commitment to transformative change

div.span: Congratulations to Abigail Adamiak for her selection to the PMEA Honors Choir.

img.alt: Photo of student Abigail Adamiak in her PMEA choir robe.

div.span: Congratulations to Jessica Reed and Lea Helsel for Making PMEA District I Honors Band!

img.alt: Photo of two avonworth musicians, Jessica and Lea, holding their instruments sitting on a bench outside the sch=ool

div.span: Congratulations to the Inaugural Class of the Avonworth Hall of Distinction! Mr. James Knox (deceased), Dr. Bruno Raso, Mr. Charles Lenzner, Mr. John Lenzner, & Mr. Robert Schulz

img.alt: Congratulations to the Inaugural Class of the Avonworth Hall of Distinction! Mr. James Knox (deceased), Dr. Bruno Raso, Mr. Charles Lenzner, Mr. John Lenzner, & Mr. Robert Schulz

div.span: Avonworth School District has been recognized as one of the Best Communities for Music Education in America by the NAMM Foundation. This recognition acknowledges the Avonworth School District's commitment to and support of music education in its schools.

img.alt: Avonworth Music

div.span: Avonworth School District is very proud of the #bethekindkid message that was created by a group of primary students. After starting a student-run business called JAM Enterprises, the message was created and printed onto t-shirts. This wonderful and very important message is spreading throughout the region and beyond due to the popularity of the message and #bethekindkid t-shirt!

img.alt: photo of primary and elementary students in a classroom wearing their #bethekindkid t-shirts and giving a thumbs up

span.div: The Avonworth School District has established a reputation for providing excellent educational opportunities for its students and ensuring their needs come first. Our mission is to empower students through authentic experiences to become creative, innovative thinkers.

div.span: © 2020. Avonworth School District. All Rights Reserved.
